# numberOfTouches

**Instance Property**

The number of touches involved in the gesture represented by the gesture recognizer.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var numberOfTouches: Int { get }
```

## Return Value

The number of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITouch] objects in a private array maintained by the receiver. Each of these objects represents a touch in the current gesture.

## Discussion

Using the value returned by this method in a loop, you can ask for the location of individual touches using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizer/location(ofTouch:in:)] method.

## Getting the touches and location of a gesture

- **location(in:)**: Returns the point computed as the location in a given view of the gesture represented by the gesture recognizer.
- **location(ofTouch:in:)**: Returns the location of one of the gesture’s touches in the local coordinate system of a given view.
